programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A recluse mountain man becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta by Indians, and proves to be a match for their warriors.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill travels to Ciudad Juarez to accept a job from a cattleman, only to find out he's actually been hired to become a scapegoat in a counterfeiting scheme.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A rancher warns Bill and the railroad workers not to put track down through the land his cattle graze on, even though it is government land; he shoots one of the workers, which sends the rest of the workers into a lynching mood.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill tries to find out who's supplying whiskey to railroad workers during their working hours in order to halt railroad progress; he first suspects a saloon owner, but it becomes clear she's not the guilty party.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill agrees to take his former Civil War commander's oldest son with him to make a man out of him; Bill quickly detects the son has an intense bitterness towards his father.

programme.title: Fort Vengeance
programme.desc: Two North Dakota brothers (James Craig, Keith Larsen) flee to Canada and join the Mounties during an Indian dispute.

programme.title: Gunfighters of Abilene
programme.desc: A gunslinger (Buster Crabbe) goes after the land baron (Barton MacLane) who framed and killed his brother.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Train robbers steal a relief shipment for flood victims.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A doctor provides his outlaw brother with a phony death certificate.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A lucky prospector is the suspect for his partners' murders.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy tries to recover the plans of a murdered civil engineer.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Bullies evict an old man from his ranch.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A band of vigilantes fights a gang of stage robbers.

programme.title: Fort Osage
programme.desc: A scout (Rod Cameron) leads a wagon train through territory made hostile by a violated treaty.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A young woman meets an outlaw; Matt investigates a railroad holdup.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: An outlaw convinces the son of a former gang-member to join his gang.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt's old friend, Tom Horn, turns into an outlaw and starts a land war.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie look into Ben Thompson's background; Matt gets a job at a gambling den to obtain evidence about Ben's criminal activities.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt arrests John Allison; Frankie's doctor is kidnapped; Clay falls into Matt's trap.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A train is robbed and money stolen; Matt Clark and Margaret Jones investigate; a shipment of dynamite is also reported missing.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret arrive at Fort Huachuca, Arizona to confer with Al Seiber in the murder of a ticket agent.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A railroad detective pursues famous criminals.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Detectives Matt and Margaret try to find a youth who disappeared while traveling in Kansas, but uncover more missing people with one thing in common -- they all stayed with Kate Bender.

programme.title: Dakota Incident
programme.desc: Indians trap a bank robber (Dale Robertson), a beauty (Linda Darnell), a bank clerk (John Lund) and other stagecoach passengers in a gully.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A desperate, mute man steals from the stagecoach.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Outlaws force Lucas to help with a prison break.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates the sinking of a record number of Mississippi river boats.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: A pair of beautiful thieves robs a high-stakes poker game hosted on Yancy's boat.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A hired hand (Claude Akins) victimizes the Cartwrights' disabled neighbor (Harry Townes).

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Outlaws plot to steal a trunk containing the savings of a religious group heading for a new life in the West.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The Cartwrights' neighbor (Franchot Tone), a former soldier and lawman, seeks security for his daughter.

programme.title: The Deadly Companions
programme.desc: An ex-army officer accidentally kills a woman's son and tries to make up for it.
